# ðŸš€ Git Neo - Quick Start Guide

Get started with Git Neo in 5 minutes!

---

## ðŸ“¦ Installation

```bash
npm install -g git-neo
```

---

## âš¡ First Run

Navigate to your Git repository and run:

```bash
git-neo setup
```

You'll see:

```
  â•”â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•—
```

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Basic Usage

### 1. Smart Push (Most Common)

Add, commit, and push in one command:

```bash
git-neo push "add new feature"
```

### 2. AI-Powered Commit

Let AI write your commit message:

```bash
git-neo ai-commit
```

You'll see:
```
â ¹ Generating AI commit message...
âœ“ AI commit message generated

ðŸ¤– AI Generated Commit Message:
   "feat: implement user authentication with JWT"

? What would you like to do?
  âœ“ Use this message
  âœŽ Edit this message
  â†» Generate new message
  âœ— Cancel
```

### 3. Interactive Mode

For a visual menu:

```bash
git-neo
```

Choose from:
- [1] Smart Push
- [2] Commit
- [3] Branch Management
- [4] Merge Branch
- [5] Repository Status

---

## ðŸ¤– AI Setup (Optional but Recommended)

### Get API Key

1. Visit: https://makersuite.google.com/app/apikey
2. Click "Create API Key"
3. Copy your key

### Configure

**During Setup**:
```bash
git-neo setup
# Choose: Enable AI Commits = Yes
# Paste your API key
# Select model
```

**Or use Environment Variable**:
```bash
# Windows (PowerShell)
$env:GEMINI_API_KEY="your-api-key"

# Linux/Mac
export GEMINI_API_KEY="your-api-key"
```

---

## ðŸ“ Common Commands

```bash
# Push changes
git-neo push "your message"

# Commit without pushing
git-neo commit "your message"

# AI commit
git-neo ai-commit

# Pull changes
git-neo pull

# View status
git-neo status

# Branch management
git-neo branch

# Merge branch
git-neo merge feature-branch
```

---

## ðŸŽ¨ Choose Your Style

### Conventional Commits (Recommended)
```bash
git-neo setup
# Choose: Commit Style = Conventional

# Your input: "add login"
# Actual commit: "chore: add login"
```

### Custom Prefix
```bash
git-neo setup
# Choose: Commit Style = Custom
# Enter prefix: "[PROJECT]"

# Your input: "add login"
# Actual commit: "[PROJECT] add login"
```

### Simple (Free-form)
```bash
git-neo setup
# Choose: Commit Style = Simple

# Your input: "add login"
# Actual commit: "add login"
```

---

## âš™ï¸ Configuration

Your settings are stored in `.gitkit.json`:

```json
{
  "defaultBranch": "main",
  "autoPush": true,
  "autoFetch": true,
  "commitStyle": "conventional",
  "aiEnabled": true,
  "aiApiKey": "your-key",
  "aiModel": "gemini-pro"
}
```

**Important**: Add to `.gitignore`:
```bash
echo ".gitkit.json" >> .gitignore
```

---

## ðŸ’¡ Pro Tips

### 1. Use AI for Complex Changes
When you've made many changes:
```bash
git-neo ai-commit
```

### 2. Enable Auto-Fetch
Stay synced with your team:
```bash
git-neo setup
# Choose: autoFetch = Yes
```

### 3. Quick Commits
For simple changes:
```bash
git-neo push "fix typo"
```

### 4. Interactive Mode
When you're not sure what to do:
```bash
git-neo
```

---

## ðŸ†˜ Troubleshooting

### "AI not configured"
```bash
git-neo setup
# Enable AI and enter your API key
```

### "Not a git repository"
```bash
git init
# or navigate to a git repository
```

### "No remote configured"
```bash
git remote add origin <your-repo-url>
```
